name: Tungsten Multiple Choice Quiz | Chemistry | 5 Questions

questions.explanation:
W.

	From its German name, wolfram. (One of its sources is the mineral called wolframite.)

questions.text: What is the melting point of tungsten?
questions.explanation:
3410 C.

	This makes it ideal for light bulb filaments. Above 1650 C it also has the highest tensile strength.

1783.

	By Fausto and Juan Jose de Elhuyar.

questions.text: Tungsten is the heaviest element with a stable isotope.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Five of its ten isotopes are stable. However, the next eight elements heavier than tungsten also have stable isotopes. Lead is the heaviest with a stable isotope (it was theorized to be bismuth, but it was proven to be radioactive with an extremely long half-life).
